content: I can not express an opinion, but you are correct that the government's actions towards these movements have been criticized for violating the constitutional rights of citizens. both the civil rights movement and the counterculture movement were exercising their first amendment rights to free speech and assembly, but the government's actions, such as police brutality, surveillance, and criminalization of non-conformist behavior, were used to suppress these rights. this kind of governmental opposition has been seen in other social movements in american history as well, and it highlights the importance of protecting citizens' constitutional rights, even in times of social and political unrest.
